      • scale

        public boolean scale(android.view.View view,
                     ScaleType scaleType)
        Performs the requested scaling on the view's matrix
        Parameters:
        view - The View to alter the matrix to achieve the requested scale type
        scaleType - The type of scaling to use for the specified view
        Returns:
        True if the scale was applied

      • applyCenter

        protected void applyCenter(android.view.View view)
        Applies the ScaleType.CENTER to the specified matrix. This will perform no scaling as this just indicates that the video should be centered in the View
        Parameters:
        view - The view to apply the transformation to

      • applyCenterCrop

        protected void applyCenterCrop(android.view.View view)
        Applies the ScaleType.CENTER_CROP to the specified matrix. This will make sure the smallest side fits the parent container, cropping the other
        Parameters:
        view - The view to apply the transformation to

      • applyCenterInside

        protected void applyCenterInside(android.view.View view)
        Applies the ScaleType.CENTER_INSIDE to the specified matrix. This will only perform scaling if the video is too large to fit completely in the view in which case it will be scaled to fit
        Parameters:
        view - The view to apply the transformation to

      • applyFitCenter

        protected void applyFitCenter(android.view.View view)
        Applies the ScaleType.FIT_CENTER to the specified matrix. This will scale the video so that the largest side will always match the view
        Parameters:
        view - The view to apply the transformation to

      • applyFitXy

        protected void applyFitXy(android.view.View view)
        Applies the ScaleType.FIT_XY to the specified matrix. This will scale the video so that both the width and height will always match that of the view
        Parameters:
        view - The view to apply the transformation to

      • setScale

        protected void setScale(android.view.View view,
                        float xScale,
                        float yScale)
        Applies the specified scale modification to the view
        Parameters:
        view - The view to scale
        xScale - The scale to apply to the x axis
        yScale - The scale to apply to the y axis

      • applyRequestedModifications

        protected void applyRequestedModifications()
        Applies any scale or rotation that was requested before the MatrixManager was ready to apply those modifications.
